nodes.bodyText: We may want to change this to if (!AuthenticationType.DATABASE.name().equals(existingUser.getAuthenticationType())) {. This way if we change DATABASE we only have to change it in one place.
Why not make this an enum and then let the accessor worry about converting to/from Long?

nodes.bodyText: Use an enum now to handle the mapping of the database id to the enumeration.  The accessor uses methods on the enum to be able to get the correct type.

nodes.bodyText: Should we allow this to throw unchecked exceptions if the id is invalid?
Actually, it looks like this reads from a map, so no exception, but it can return null. We might want to wrap it in an optional.
